title: UPDATE: Two Killed in North St. Louis Home
content:
story updated at 4:04pm on August 10, 2013
ST. LOUIS (KMOX) –St. Louis city police are releasing more details on the north side shootings Friday night that left two dead.
Officers say 27-year-old Brian Jermon answered the door of his home in the 4200 block of East Kossuth and was shot in the neck.
Twenty-six-year-old Franchelle Harris of Jennings was then shot in the back.
Both Jermon and Harris died a short time later at hospitals.
Police say two others in the home, identified only as a 22-year-old woman and 29-year-old man, were also shot, but are expected to survive.
Officers do not have a good description yet of the gunman.
our earlier story:
ST. LOUIS (KMOX) – Two people are dead and two others are hospitalized after a shooting Friday night in north St. Louis. It happened around nine o’clock at an apartment in the 42-hundred block of East Kossuth, near O’Fallon Park.
Police say a man and woman died at the scene. Another man was shot in the leg. The injured woman was shot in the buttocks. They are reported in stable condition.
Police have no description of the suspects.
